question: Who conceived the effective communication theory 'Three Modes of Persuasion' (comprising Logos, Ethos and Pathos)?
api_result: The effective communication theory known as the "Three Modes of Persuasion," which includes Logos (appeal to logic), Ethos (appeal to credibility or ethics), and Pathos (appeal to emotion), was conceived by the ancient Greek philosopher Aristotle. He discussed these modes in his work "Rhetoric," where he explored how speakers can persuade their audiences through different appeals.
